Yes, you should try Jtest from ParaSoft.  It will automatically generate ha=
rness around the class and stub out any external call.  It will also execut=
e the testcases you wrote using Junit and provide you with a coverage analy=
sis.  In addition, it will also generate dynamic test cases for you automat=
ically.   

----- Original Message -----
From: markus baumgartner
Sent: Fri=
day, March 15, 2002 8:16 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Is t=
here a tool which generates JUnit-test stubs?


I'm spending a lot of time =
passing new method into the testclass and write a
"test_" in front of it (a=
nd oftenly forget to do it, too).
I made a try to automate the creation of =
stubs for all existing methods of a
class using the Reflection API (e.g. fr=
om myProcedure(int A, String B) to
test_myProcedure_int_A_String_B. The fin=
al goal would be to have the tool
comparing the class to the test_class and=
 create stubs for new methods
while leaving the existing ones untouched.

B=
efore I'm going to create it on my own, I wanted to know, if anybody knows
=
about an existing tool, that does the job?

If it does not exist, is there =
a good reason, why this automation wouldn't
make sense? Sometimes for compl=
ex function you may need several testcases,
but they can be easely created =
by taking the first stub and append a
number...
